snippet: Jobless claims rose sharply last week, while housing starts dropped in April and a gauge of underlying inflation indicated weak demand.
abstract: Labor Department reports that applications for weekly unemployment benefits climbed by 32,000 to a seasonally adjusted 360,000, fastest pace in six months; housing starts also tumbled in April; data could feed fears over impact of government austerity drive and could raise pressure on Federal Reserve to buy bonds.
lead_paragraph: Jobless claims rose sharply last week, while housing starts dropped in April and a gauge of underlying inflation indicated weak demand.

headline.seo: Jobless Claims Rise and Housing Starts Fall
headline.main: New Jobless Claims Rise, and Housing Starts Fall
headline.print_headline: New Jobless Claims Rise, And Housing Starts Fall
